explanation: The report is correct. MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 prohibits modifying function parameters (scalar parameters included). In the shown function the parameter 'len' is overwritten and decremented in several places (len = io->size - offset; len--; len -= sizeof(int); etc.), so the rule is violated. Using a local copy (e.g. int remaining = len) would remedy this. Pointer parameters are not reassigned here (dst is copied to local 'dest'), so the only violation is the modification of the scalar parameter 'len'.
